activities.loc: Br 3 - Law Enforcement Center - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operate w/o Valid License (2nd w/in 3 yrs)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaac Gomez

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:20 AM Defendant Isaac Gomez in court.  Attorney Azucena C Guizar Ms. in court for State of Wisconsin. Interpreter services provided by Vicki Bermudez. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a status conference. 
Defendant indicates he plans to get an attorney. 
Court instructs the defendant to go to the public defender's office to see if he qualifies for services. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State's NOI to Intro Deft's Statements
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Do not drive unless properly licensed. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

2:24 PM Defendant Isaac Gomez appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Addison R Kuhn appeared by video for Isaac Gomez.  Prosecuting attorney Antoinette L. Rich appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. Spanish interpreter, Vicki Bermudez by video.
BTC: Warrant vacated.
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on October 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Initial appearance on September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
TO TRACK IN SAME BRANCH AS OPEN CASE 22CM806
